channel.title: [317 Delta] slayer in quest tab?*HELP!*
channel.description: How do i make it say how many monsters are left to kill for slayer in the quest tab?

item.title: [317 Delta] slayer in quest tab?*HELP!*
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“purestmage74, post:11, topic:443334”]Feel like i’m being trolled lol

A i’nt’ is a (number) in java.

a ‘String’ is a (letter) in java.

a ‘boolean’ is (true or false) in java.

That’s how you learn to program as a beginner, learn to play around with variables such as the ones above, or if you can comprehend them, move to more variables such as ‘long’ ‘double’ < those are numbers also.

Example of playing

	public void test() {
		int health = 100;
		int maxHealth = 100;
		int minHealth = 0;
		boolean dead = false;
		if (health <= minHealth) { // if health is less than or equal to 0;
			health = minHealth; // set his health to 0, prevents dropping into negatives.
			dead = true; // his health is equal to 0, which means he's dead..
		} else if (health > minHealth) { // if health is greater than 0.
			dead = false; // he's obviously not dead..
			health = health; // so his health is equal to whatever his current health is..
		}
	}

idk what anyone is talking about, all i need to know is what to put in my quest tab for it to say how many kills are left for slayer.

Well were NOT going to just shove pie down your throat when you’re hungry.
You go learn how to make the pie…
Than from there you can learn to make different pies/more advanced pies. :)[/quote]I could totally use some pie.
I’m gonna get some pie brb

Read full topic

A i’nt’ is a (number) in java.

a ‘String’ is a (letter) in java.

a ‘boolean’ is (true or false) in java.

That’s how you learn to program as a beginner, learn to play around with variables such as the ones above, or if you can comprehend them, move to more variables such as ‘long’ ‘double’ < those are numbers also.

Example of playing

	public void test() {
		int health = 100;
		int maxHealth = 100;
		int minHealth = 0;
		boolean dead = false;
		if (health <= minHealth) { // if health is less than or equal to 0;
			health = minHealth; // set his health to 0, prevents dropping into negatives.
			dead = true; // his health is equal to 0, which means he's dead..
		} else if (health > minHealth) { // if health is greater than 0.
			dead = false; // he's obviously not dead..
			health = health; // so his health is equal to whatever his current health is..

idk what anyone is talking about, all i need to know is what to put in my quest tab for it to say how many kills are left for slayer.

Well were NOT going to just shove pie down your throat when you’re hungry.
You go learn how to make the pie…
Than from there you can learn to make different pies/more advanced pies.

[quote=“purestmage74, post:8, topic:443334”] int age = 9; int motivation = 0; boolean needsHelp; if (age < 10) { needsHelp = true; } else { if (motivation == 0) { needsHelp = true; } else if (motivation > 0) { needsHelp = false; } } [/quote]
You should explain that piece of code a little to him.

item.title: [317 Delta] slayer in quest tab?*HELP!*
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

supermimez:

idk how to assign a “variable”

int myVariable;     // Creates an integer variable
myVariable = 1337;    // Assigns the variable a value of 1337

Or, you can do both in one line…

int myVariable = 1337; // Creates an integer variables and assigns the variable a value of 1337.

I’m sure you can figure out how to assign a variable from the above.

item.title: [317 Delta] slayer in quest tab?*HELP!*
item.dc:creator: @supermimez supermimez
item.description:
@supermimez wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:2, topic:443334”]Assign a variable when you get the task E.G. killsLeft = 50;
Everytime you kill the monster you’re assigned to kill decrease one on that number. killsLeft -= 1;
Display that variable in your quest tab.[/quote]

item.title: [317 Delta] slayer in quest tab?*HELP!*
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

Assign a variable when you get the task E.G. killsLeft = 50;
Everytime you kill the monster you’re assigned to kill decrease one on that number. killsLeft -= 1;
Display that variable in your quest tab.

Read full topic
